content.explanation:
A relation is any set of ordered pairs (x, y) that shows a relationship between inputs and outputs.

A function is a special type of relation where each x-value (input) corresponds to exactly one y-value (output).

In other words, all functions are relations, but not all relations are functions.
content.key_point: To determine if a relation is a function, check if any input value is paired with more than one output value. If yes, it's not a function.
